summary: This document appears to be a court record from Palm Beach County showing Jeffrey Epstein's criminal case details, including charges, pleas, and sentencing for felony offenses related to prostitution involving minors. It shows Epstein pleaded guilty and was adjudicated guilty on June 30, 2008.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: The primary defendant in the criminal case, charged with felony offenses related to prostitution involving minors, pleaded guilty and was adjudicated guilty by the court.

events.title: Offense Date for Prostitution Charge
events.description: The date of the offense for which Jeffrey Epstein was charged with felony offer to commit prostitution.

events.title: Offense Date for Procuring Minor Charge
events.description: The date of the offense for which Jeffrey Epstein was charged with procuring a person under age 18 for prostitution.

events.title: Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty and was adjudicated guilty by the court on two felony charges related to prostitution involving minors, with sentencing including jail time and community service.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with two felony counts: 1) felony offer to commit prostitution (offense date 10/31/2005) and 2) procuring a person under age 18 for prostitution (offense date 10/09/2005).
Epstein pleaded guilty to both charges and was adjudicated guilty by the court on June 30, 2008.
The sentencing included jail time (6 months for one count, 12 months for the other) and community service time.
This appears to be the official court record of Epstein's 2008 plea deal in Palm Beach County.
The document shows the case was handled in Palm Beach County Circuit Court under case numbers 50-2006-CF-009454-AXXX-MB and 50-2008-CF-00938LAXXX-MB.
